fields.Title of Contribution: <span><span style="font-size:11pt;">Impact of a Light Volleyball Intervention among Older Chinese Adult Women.</span></span>
fields.Journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
fields.Description/Abstract: Modified sports offer a strategic approach to promoting health in older adults. Light<br>volleyball, which uses a larger, lighter ball than traditional volleyball, is more accessible<br>for this population. This study investigated the effects of a 16-week light volleyball<br>program on the functional fitness of older adults in Hong Kong. A total of 275 participants<br>aged 60 years or older were recruited and randomly assigned to three groups: a light<br>volleyball intervention group, a Tai Chi group, and a control group. Functional fitness was<br>assessed at the pretest, posttest, and 6-month follow-up. Results revealed that the light<br>volleyball group exhibited more significant improvements in lower and upper limb<br>strength, agility, dynamic balance, and aerobic endurance than did the Tai Chi and control<br>groups. This study highlights the effectiveness of light volleyball as a newly emerging,<br>group-based sport physical activity for promoting healthy aging in older adult women. The<br>use of light volleyball in future health promotion initiatives is highly recommended.
